medical_history.chief_complaint: 5 days of epigastric pain worsened with recumbency, associated with nausea and vomiting coincident with alcohol use.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 days ago with epigastric pain that is worse when lying down and is accompanied by nausea and vomiting. The pain has been associated with alcohol use, with average consumption being 1 large bottle of vodka daily for the last 18 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic alcohol abuse (1 bottle of vodka daily for last 18 months), depression (medications stopped weeks ago), attention deficit disorder (not on medication), history of domestic violence. No surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Father has diabetes type 2 and hypertension; no cancers or drug addiction noted.
medical_history.social_history: Chronic alcohol use; stated to be a victim of domestic abuse. No other social factors discussed.
